title: Why is Shaco getting major nerfs?

replies.body: The same reason Yasuo has a ton of skins for a newer champ compared to some old champs in DESPERATE NEED of them.  Because hundreds of thousands of weebs play Yasuo and spend money on him and like five people play Shaco.  It used to be six, but that last guy got banned.

>Yasuo has a ton of skins for a newer champ

Actually he is in line with every champ released slightly before and after him. Even Aatroxx, 3 releases prior to Yasuo, has as many skins as him, both with 3. If you're going to complain about a new champ with a lot of skins, Gnar is your best option, and even then he only has one more than Yasuo/Aatrox.
Son, I don't need a reason to complain about Yasuo.

Do you remember Season 2, before the shift from red and blue buff XP to the smaller minions in the camp? 

Nunu, Shaco and Shyvana could just invade the enemy jungle, steal the buff from the enemy, get level 2 instantly and kill them or run away.

Now, after four long years we're going back to that, with red and blue buff being solo camps that get you to level 2 instantly. If Shaco remains as strong as he is, his invasions would decide games at level 1. The new jungle is very punishing to try and go through while you're down a level, down a buff, it's honestly just too strong and it's going to take a long time for people to get used to it. And Shaco would thrive in that confusion and make people just quit the game.

That is a lame excuse to gut shaco. If this makes shaco problematic then do something about what causes it , which is his insanely fast first clear due to stacked boxes, and don't nerf the crap out of a champion.
Speed of clear isn't the issue. It's strength of invasion. With only a 1.5 second Stealth duration and a 3 second CD on Backstab Shaco should be content to stay on his side of the map early.
Except that's fucking stupid? The whole point is he has an incredibly strong early and should prey upon champions rather than farming since his early farming past his level 1 clear is shit.
Riot stated the point is to tone down his early game. This is a nerf until they get a chance to VGU him. Like Soraka or Urgot.
His early didn't need a nerf.

Because Riot hates Shaco. Always has, always will.

Yasuo, on the other hand, makes #LCSBIGPLAYS, so he'll always be OP, similar to Lee Sin.
Shaco is really interesting to watch though so I dont see why not buff him. At least far more interesting then Rumble or Reksai.
Because Shaco isn't Zed. That simple.
The same reason Akali is getting nerfed, Riot doesn't want them to be playable, let alone viable.
Looks like riot is intending to throw him in he dumpster until his VGUS like they did with poppy, urgot and other unhealthy champions.

Because Yasuo's fan base is bigger

Remember Lee rework 2014 that got cancelled lmao

Because shaco is being reworked right now and yasuo is not?

Also a few systemic changes help shaco, as enemy junglers will be easier to kill without SoA and control wards will not detect him like pinks do. The inclusion of "plants" is also probably slightly power positive since his boxes (which now last longer) can be placed to watch for or royally mess up an enemy attempt to use the plant)

Admittedly, the shaco changes seem a bit skewed towards AP, so if you prefer ad I see how the box and ult changes are less than thrilling.

I agree that yasuo is one of the more frustrating champions to face. I wish there was some way to make him less frustrating to face without removing his ability to lane mid, but frustrating machanics seem to be the most effective mechanics to enable a melee to function vs a ranged, especially in such a short lane.
